page.title: 04EDUCATION 2
page.content: 2 CONTD....MOVED TO QUEEN ELIZABETH GRAMMAR SCHOOL IN ALFORD HAVING PASSED THE 11+ EXAM. IN 1964 THE JOHN BIRKBECK SCHOOL WAS OPENED AS A SECONDARY MODERN,WHICH CATEGORY OF SCHOOL HAD BEEN CREATED BY THE 1944 ACT ALONG WITH TECHNICAL HIGH SCHOOLS TO FORM A TRIPARTITE SYSTEM WITH THE ALREADY EXISTING GRAMMAR SCHOOLS.IT REMAINED A SECONDARY MODERN UNTIL 1974 WHEN IT JOINED THE LOUTH PLAN AS A SEMI COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL.THE LOUTH PLAN HAD COME INTO EXISTENCE IN 1966 AS A MEANS OF REMOVING THE SELECTIVE 11+EXAM WHICH,BY THEN WAS BECOMONG DISCREDITED ALTHOUGH IT CONTINUES IN USE STILL IN SOME PARTS OF THE COUNTY.THE LOUTH PLAN WORKED SIMPLY - TWO FORMR SECONDARY MODERN SCHOOLS, MONKS'DYKE AND CORDEAUX WERE RE-STYLED
